reviews.review_msg: Like someone else said, Christian is the definition of "chaotic good." He is so engaging to have in class and is very personable and funny. He is always open to questions and discussions. I actually looked forward to his class every week! In order to do well in classes, read notes before class. His lectures are additional info. and application.

Although he is an amazing and funny person, his class was very difficult to follow. Extremely disorganized, NEVER replies to emails and does not have any guidelines for assignments/tests. He never told us about assignment due dates or when tests were going to be. He spent the first month teaching us about things that didn't even end up on the MT

Disorganized, doesn't set you up for success, gives no writing feedback the entire semester and then wants a 7 page research paper due right before the final exam. Unfair expectations, way more work than any of my 400-level French courses.

The most challenging & disorganized course I have ever taken. Very difficult to understand what is going on/what material you will need for evaluations. On the exams, concepts that were never discussed in class or discussed very fleetingly. No textbook makes this class incomprehensible as you have to dig through academic papers to find information.

This guy is the definition of chaotic good. He lets students debate the grading at the beginning of semester, he always takes longer than he thinks he will for Modules, Powerpoints, etc. He only speaks in French! Very kind and caring, good sense of humour, easily accessible, clear instructions. He goes on tangents, is distractible but great vibes

Christian is my favorite prof at SFU. He explains all concepts in great detail, if you listen carefully in class and participate, you should do fine on the tests. He is very passionate about linguistics and made me love it too. Make sure you take notes and practice if you wish to perform above and beyond. Don't miss out on getting to know him!

Great as a person, as a teacher you have been warned. Have had previous classes with him that went ok, but this semester was a bit of a disaster. 3/4 of the class failed the midterm, tested on "what we learned in class" but seminars were all over the place and no PPTs. If possible, I would take another class; course material re-used and unclear.

His disorganization makes this class REALLY frustrating. You need to dig through all his PowerPoints and articles to find the relevant information. If you read everything and attend every lecture, your mark may still be low! Not handing back assignments means  you can't tell what was expected/deemed correct for tests!

Overall average prof. Somewhat disorganized, though knew material pretty well and explained things well (though perhaps too much, since he speaks very quickly). Very willing to help and encouraging during office hours. He should learn students names--got impression teaching for him is a job, but researching is really what he'd prefer to be doing.

Very enthusiastic and likeable as a person but he is a completely disorganized prof who only uses the incomplete website from his previous course that no longer exists. Hands out worksheets on certain topics never mentioned in class. Lacks clarity in his delivery in lectures, and tests do not reflect the knowledge learned in class.

Bad prof! Although he is very competent in his field, he is horrible at communicating info, unorganized (uses only slides from fren270-which doesn't exist anymore. midterm average=40%, tests do not reflect what we learned. Was never at his office hours, was not helpful over emails. I would never recommend him to anyone.

Christian is nice, very funny and he is a fair marker. His tests are straight forward, study his powerpoint notes and do the practice questions he gives out for the exams and you should be fine. He may take long to respond to emails but see him in person, he's always available to help.

so-so prof but he keeps the class awake.  he's prob in the wrong department... he should be teaching theatre or something.  sometimes a little disorganized (typos in notes) and talks about really random things....but generally a good prof.

This prof is so fine!!!Kind of a bad teacher cuz he cant really explain stuff well, but he is sooooooo nice and funny and sooooooo goodlooking. I'd retake a class with him just so that i can stare at him. Total eye candy ladies... take the class!

Prof. Guilbault was funny and made me laugh several times! But he is also knowledgeable and can communicate most concepts effectively to students. The material presented in class was, however, quite confusing, and almost everyone, me included, was lost up until the final exam!
irresponsible, doesn't return emails, disappointing class

A very funny, helpful and interesting prof. He made linguistics amusing and class was never boring. He is a fair teacher and he is dedicated. He can be a little unorganized and makes a lot of errors (on notes and tests) but he is still great. Would definitely takes courses taught byhim again.

I've never taken an linguistics course before, and I thought I'd hate it - not with Christian! He's extremely smart (naturally, he has a PhD..) funny (which makes linguistics more enjoyable) and his tests/marking are very fair. And yes..he's quite the hottie... :) :)

Any French student should take FREN 270 with this prof. He is one of the best profs I've ever had. He explains linguistic concepts clearly and his exams are based on class readings/notes. He really makes linguistics interesting. Oh, and girls, he is very good-looking =)
No Comments
No Comments
Wicked teacher, young and funny, made me believe linguistics can be interesting!
